DOC.brief_summary: To investigate treatment effect Jetstream G3 System moderate severely calcified peripheral artery disease common femoral , superficial femoral popliteal artery use intravascular ultrasound ( IVUS ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . The patient ≥ 18 year age . 2 . Patient claudication determine due femoropopliteal lesion ( ) require revascularization . 3 . The target lesion ( ) is/are locate common femoral , superficial femoral popliteal artery . 4 . The reference vessel lumen ( proximal target lesion ) ≥ 3.0mm . 5 . The patient acceptable candidate percutaneous intervention use Jetstream G3 System accordance label indication instruction use . 6 . The patient sign approve informed consent . 7 . Moderate severe vessel obstructive intraluminal calcification demonstrate IVUS angiography . 1 . Patient uncontrollable allergy nitinol , stainless steel stent material contrast agent . 2 . Patient unable take appropriate antiplatelet therapy . 3 . Patient distal runoff vessel . 4 . Deep wall calcium . 5 . Interventional treatment intend instent restenosis peripheral vascular site . 6 . Patient target vessel moderate severe angulation ( e.g. , > 30 degree ) tortuosity treatment segment . 7 . Patient history coagulopathy hypercoagulable bleeding disorder . 8 . Patient receive hemodialysis impair renal function ( creatinine > 2.5 mg/dl ) time treatment . 9 . Patient evidence intracranial gastrointestinal bleeding within past 3 month . 10 . Patient severe trauma , fracture , major surgery biopsy parenchymal organ within past 14 day . 11 . Patient pregnant nursing child . 12 . Intended interventional treatment include plan laser , brachytherapy atherectomy procedure Jetstream G3 System .
